1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		locate_module.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
13   |  ** 									     **
14   |  **   Description: 	Contains the routines which locate the actual	     **
15   |  **			modulefile given a modulefilename by looking in all  **
16   |  **			of the paths in MODULEPATH. 			     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Exports:		Locate_ModuleFile				     **
19   |  **			SourceRC					     **
20   |  **			SourceVers					     **
21   |  ** 									     **
22   |  **   Notes:								     **
23   |  ** 									     **
24   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
25   |  ****/
26   | 
27   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
28   |  ** 									     **
29   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
30   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
31   |  ** 									     ** 
32   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
33   | 
34   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: locate_module.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:34 rkowen Exp $";
35   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
36   | 
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/

40   | 
41   | #include "modules_def.h"
42   | #include "uvec.h"
43   | 
44   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
45   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
46   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
47   | 
48   | /** not applicable **/
49   | 
50   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
51   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
52   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
53   | 
54   | #define	SRCFRAG	100
55   | 
56   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
57   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
58   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
59   | 
60   | /** not applicable **/
61   | 
62   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
63   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | 
66   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
67   | static	char	strbuffer[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
68   | static	char	modfil_buf[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
69   | 
70   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
71   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
72   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
73   | 
74   | static	char	 *GetModuleName( Tcl_Interp*, char*, char*, char*);
75   | 
76   | /*++++
77   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
78   |  ** 									     **
79   |  **   Function:		Locate_ModuleFile				     **
80   |  ** 									     **
81   |  **   Description:	Searches for a modulefile given a string argument    **
82   |  **			which is either a full path or a modulefile name     **
83   |  **			-- usually the argument the user gave. If it's not a **
84   |  **			full path, the directories in the MODULESPATH	     **
85   |  **			environment variable are searched to find a match    **
86   |  **			for the given name.				     **
87   |  ** 									     **
88   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
89   |  ** 									     **
90   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl interpr.**
91   |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module to**
92   |  **							be located	     **
93   |  **			char		*realname	Real modulename (with**
94   |  **							version)	     **
95   |  **			char		*filename	Real    full module  **
96   |  **							file path	     **
97   |  ** 									     **
98   |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK or TCL_ERROR		     **
99   |  **			filename	the full path of the required module **
100  |  **					file is copied in here		     **
101  |  ** 									     **
102  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
103  |  **						by the current command	     **
104  |  ** 									     **
105  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
106  |  ++++*/
107  | 
108  | int Locate_ModuleFile(
109  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
110  | 	char *modulename,
111  | 	char *realname,
112  | 	char *filename
113  | ) {
114  | 	char           *p;		/** Tokenization pointer	     **/
115  | 	char           *result = NULL;	/** This functions result	     **/
116  | 	uvec           *pathvec;	/** Vector of paths to scan	     **/
117  | 	char          **pathlist;	/** List of paths to scan	     **/
118  | 	int             numpaths,	/** Size of this list		     **/
119  | 	                i;		/** Loop counter		     **/
120  | 	char           *modulespath;	/** Buffer for the contents of the   **/
121  | 					/** environment variable MODULEPATH  **/
122  | 	char           *mod, *vers;	/** Module and version name for sym- **/
123  | 					/** bolic name lookup		     **/
124  |     /**
125  |      **  If it is a full path name, that's the module file to load.
126  |      **/
127  | 	if (!modulename)
128  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_PARAM, LOC, "modulename", NULL))
129  | 			goto unwind0;
130  | 
131  | 	if (modulename[0] == '/' || modulename[0] == '.') {
132  | 		p = (char *)strrchr(modulename, '/');
133  | 		if (p) {
134  | 			*p = '\0';
135  | 	    /**
136  | 	     **  Check, if what has been specified is a valid version of
137  | 	     **  the specified module ...
138  | 	     **/
139  | 			if ((char *)NULL == (result =
140  | 			     GetModuleName(interp, modulename, NULL, (p + 1))))
141  | 				goto unwind0;
142  | 	    /**
143  | 	     **  Reinstall the 'modulefile' which has been corrupted by
144  | 	     **   tokenization
145  | 	     **/
146  | 			*p = '/';
147  | 	    /**
148  | 	     **  ... Looks good! Conditionally (if there has been no version
149  | 	     **  specified) we have to add the default version
150  | 	     **/
151  | 			if (!strcmp((p + 1), result)) {
152  | 				if ((char *)NULL ==
153  | 				    stringer(filename, MOD_BUFSIZE, modulename,
154  | 					     NULL))
155  | 					goto unwind1;
156  | 			} else {
157  | 				if ((char *)NULL ==
158  | 				    stringer(filename, MOD_BUFSIZE, modulename,
159  | 					     "/", result, NULL))
160  | 					goto unwind1;
161  | 			}
162  | 		} else {
163  | 	    /**
164  | 	     **  Hmm! There's no backslash in 'modulename'. So it MUST begin
165  | 	     **  on '.' and MUST be part of the current directory
166  | 	     **/
167  | 			if (NULL ==
168  | 			    (result =
169  | 			     GetModuleName(interp, modulename, NULL,
170  | 					   modulename)))
171  | 				goto unwind0;
172  | 
173  | 			if (!strcmp(modulename, result) ||
174  | 			    (strlen(modulename) + 1 + strlen(result) + 1 >
175  | 			     MOD_BUFSIZE)) {
176  | 				if ((char *)NULL ==
177  | 				    stringer(filename, MOD_BUFSIZE, modulename,
178  | 					     NULL))
179  | 					goto unwind1;
180  | 			} else {
181  | 				if ((char *)NULL ==
182  | 				    stringer(filename, MOD_BUFSIZE, modulename,
183  | 					     "/", result, NULL))
184  | 					goto unwind1;
185  | 			}
186  | 		}
187  |     /**
188  |      **  So it is not a full path name what has been specified. Scan the 
189  |      **  MODULESPATH
190  |      **/
191  | 	} else {
192  | 	/**
193  | 	 **  If I don't find a path in MODULEPATH, there's nothing to search.
194  | 	 **/
195  | 		if (!(modulespath = (char *)getenv("MODULEPATH"))) {
196  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL)) {
197  | 				g_current_module = NULL;
198  | 				goto unwind0;
199  | 			}
200  | 		}
201  | 	/**
202  | 	 ** strip off any extraneous new lines
203  | 	 **/
204  | 		{
205  | 			char           *end;
206  | 			if ((char *)NULL != (end = strrchr(modulespath, '\n')))
207  | 				*end = '\0';
208  | 		}
209  | 	/**
210  | 	 **  Expand the module name (in case it is a symbolic one). This must
211  | 	 **  be done once here in order to expand any aliases
212  | 	 **/
213  | 		if (VersionLookup(modulename, &mod, &vers)) {
214  | 			if ((char *)NULL == stringer(strbuffer, MOD_BUFSIZE,
215  | 						     mod, "/", vers, NULL))
216  | 				goto unwind0;
217  | 			modulename = strbuffer;
218  | 		}
219  | 	/**
220  | 	 **  Split up the MODULEPATH values into multiple directories
221  | 	 **/
222  | 		if (NULL == (pathvec = SplitIntoList(modulespath, &numpaths,
223  | 						     _colon)))
224  | 			goto unwind0;
225  | 		pathlist = uvec_vector(pathvec);
226  | 	/**
227  | 	 **  Check each directory to see if it contains the module
228  | 	 **/
229  | 		for (i = 0; i < numpaths; i++) {
230  | 			/* skip empty paths */
231  | 			if (*pathlist[i] && (NULL != (result =
232  | 				GetModuleName(interp, pathlist[i],
233  | 				    NULL, modulename)))) {
234  | 
235  | 				if (strlen(pathlist[i]) + 2 + strlen(result) >
236  | 				    MOD_BUFSIZE) {
237  | 					if ((char *)NULL ==
238  | 					    stringer(filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
239  | 						     pathlist[i], NULL))
240  | 						goto unwind1;
241  | 				} else {
242  | 					if ((char *)NULL ==
243  | 					    stringer(filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
244  | 						     pathlist[i], "/", result,
245  | 						     NULL))
246  | 						goto unwind1;
247  | 				}
248  | 				break;
249  | 			}
250  | 	    /**
251  | 	     **  If we havn't found it, we should try to re-expand the module
252  | 	     **  name, because some rc file have been sourced
253  | 	     **/
254  | 			if (VersionLookup(modulename, &mod, &vers)) {
255  | 				if ((char *)NULL ==
256  | 				    stringer(strbuffer, MOD_BUFSIZE, mod, "/",
257  | 					     vers, NULL))
258  | 					goto unwind1;
259  | 				modulename = strbuffer;
260  | 			}
261  | 		}
262  | 	  /** for **/
263  | 	/**
264  | 	 **  Free the memory created from the call to SplitIntoList()
265  | 	 **/
266  | 		FreeList(&pathvec);
267  | 	/**
268  | 	 **  If result still NULL, then we really never found it and we should
269  | 	 **  return ERROR and clear the full_path array for cleanliness.
270  | 	 **/
271  | 		if (!result) {
272  | 			filename[0] = '\0';
273  | 			goto unwind0;
274  | 		}
275  | 	}
276  |       /** not a full path name **/
277  |     /**
278  |      **  Free up what has been allocated and pass the result back to
279  |      **  the caller and save the real module file name returned by
280  |      **  GetModuleName
281  |      **/
282  | 	strncpy(realname, result, MOD_BUFSIZE);
283  | 	if ((char *)NULL == stringer(realname, MOD_BUFSIZE, result, NULL))
284  | 		goto unwind1;
285  | 	null_free((void *)&result);
286  | 
287  | 	return (TCL_OK);
288  | 
289  | unwind1:
290  | 	null_free((void *)&result);
291  | unwind0:
292  | 	return (TCL_ERROR);
293  | }
294  | 
295  | /*++++
296  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
297  |  ** 									     **
298  |  **   Function:		GetModuleName					     **
299  |  ** 									     **
300  |  **   Description:	Given a path and a module filename, this function    **
301  |  **			checks to find the modulefile.			     **
302  |  ** 									     **
303  |  **   Notes:		This function is RECURSIVE			     **
304  |  **									     **
305  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
306  |  ** 									     **
307  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
308  |  **			char		*path		Path to start seeking**
309  |  **			char		*prefix		Module name prefix   **
310  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module   **
311  |  ** 									     **
312  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL	Any failure( parameters, alloc)	     **
313  |  **				else	Pointer to an allocated buffer con-  **
314  |  **					taining the complete module file path**
315  |  ** 									     **
316  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
317  |  ** 									     **
318  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
319  |  ++++*/
320  | 
321  | static	char	*GetModuleName(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
322  | 			     	char		*path,
323  | 				char		*prefix,
324  | 			     	char		*modulename)
325  | {
326  |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
327  |     char	 *fullpath = NULL;	/** Buffer for creating path names   **/
328  |     char	 *Result = NULL;	/** Our return value		     **/
329  |     uvec	 *filelist = NULL;	/** Buffer for a list of possible    **/
330  | 					/** module files		     **/
331  |     int		  numlist;		/** Size of this list		     **/
332  |     int		  i, slen, is_def;
333  |     char	 *s, *t;		/** Private string buffer	     **/
334  |     char	 *mod, *ver;		/** Pointer to module and version    **/
335  |     char	 *mod1, *ver1;		/** Temp pointer		     **/
336  |     
337  |     /**
338  |      **  Split the modulename into module and version. Use a private buffer
339  |      **  for this
340  |      **/
341  |     if((char *) NULL == (s = stringer(NULL, 0,  modulename, NULL))) {
342  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
343  | 	goto unwind0;
344  |     }
345  |     slen = strlen( s) + 1;
346  |     mod = s;
347  |     if( (ver = strchr( mod, '/')) )
348  | 	*ver++ = '\0';
349  |     /**
350  |      **  Allocate a buffer for full pathname building
351  |      **/
352  |     if((char *) NULL == (fullpath = stringer(NULL, MOD_BUFSIZE, NULL))) {
353  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL)) {
354  | 	    goto unwind1;
355  | 	}
356  |     }
357  |     /**
358  |      **  Check whether $path/$prefix/$mod is a directory
359  |      **/
360  |     if( prefix) {
361  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
362  | 	path,"/",prefix,"/",mod, NULL))
363  | 	    goto unwind1;
364  |     } else {
365  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
366  | 	path,"/",mod, NULL))
367  | 	    goto unwind1;
368  |     }
369  |     is_def = !strcmp( mod, _(em_default));
370  | 
371  |     if( is_def || !stat( fullpath, &stats)) {
372  | 	/**
373  | 	 **  If it is a directory
374  | 	 **/
375  |     	if( !is_def && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
376  | 	    /**
377  | 	     **  Source the ".modulerc" file if it exists
378  | 	     **  For compatibility source the .version file, too
379  | 	     **/
380  | 	    if( prefix) {
381  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer(modfil_buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
382  | 		path,"/",mod, NULL))
383  | 		    goto unwind2;
384  | 	    } else {
385  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer(modfil_buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,mod, NULL))
386  | 		    goto unwind2;
387  | 	    }
388  | 
389  | 	    if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
390  | 	    path,"/",modfil_buf, NULL))
391  | 		goto unwind2;
392  | 	    g_current_module = modfil_buf;
393  | 
394  | 	    if( TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, fullpath, modulerc_file) ||
395  | 		TCL_ERROR == SourceVers( interp, fullpath, modfil_buf)) {
396  | 		/* flags = save_flags; */
397  | 		    goto unwind2;
398  | 	    }
399  | 	    /**
400  | 	     **  After sourcing the RC files, we have to look up versions again
401  | 	     **/
402  | 	    if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod1, &ver1)) {
403  | 		int len = strlen( mod1) + strlen( ver1) + 2;
404  | 		/**
405  | 		 **  Maybe we have to enlarge s
406  | 		 **/
407  | 		if( len > slen) {
408  | 		    null_free((void *) &s);
409  | 		    if((char *) NULL == (s = stringer( NULL, len, NULL))) {
410  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
411  | 			goto unwind2;
412  | 		    }
413  | 		    slen = len;
414  | 		}
415  | 		/**
416  | 		 **  Print the new module/version in the buffer
417  | 		 **/
418  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer( s, len, mod1,"/", ver1, NULL)) {
419  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
420  | 		    goto unwind2;
421  | 		}
422  | 		mod = s;
423  | 		if( (ver = strchr( s, '/')) )
424  | 		    *ver++ = '\0';
425  | 	    }
426  | 	    /**
427  | 	     **  recursively delve into subdirectories (until ver == NULL).
428  | 	     **/
429  | 	    if( ver) {
430  | 		int len = strlen( mod) + 1;
431  | 
432  | 		if( prefix)
433  | 		    len += strlen( prefix) +1;
434  | 		/**
435  | 		 **  Build the new prefix
436  | 		 **/
437  | 		if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, len, NULL))) {
438  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
439  | 		    goto unwind2;
440  | 		}
441  | 
442  | 		if( prefix) {
443  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t, len, prefix,"/",mod, NULL)){
444  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
445  | 			goto unwindt;
446  | 		    }
447  | 		} else {
448  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t, len, mod, NULL)){
449  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
450  | 			goto unwindt;
451  | 		    }
452  | 		}
453  | 		/**
454  | 		 **  This is the recursion
455  | 		 **/
456  | 		Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, t, ver);
457  | 
458  | 		/**
459  | 		 **  Free our temporary prefix buffer
460  | 		 **/
461  | 		null_free((void *) &t);
462  | 		if (0) {	/* an error occurred */
463  | unwindt:
464  | 		    null_free((void *) &t);
465  | 		    goto unwind2;
466  | 		}
467  | 	    } 
468  | 	} else {     /** if( $path/$prefix/$mod is a directory) **/
469  | 	    /**
470  | 	     **  Now 'mod' should be either a file or the word 'default'
471  | 	     **  In case of default get the file with the highest version number
472  | 	     **  in the current directory
473  | 	     **/
474  | 	    if( is_def) {
475  | 		if( !prefix)
476  | 		    prefix = ".";
477  | 		if( NULL == (filelist = SortedDirList( path, prefix,&numlist)))
478  | 		    goto unwind1;
479  | 
480  | 		prefix = (char *) NULL;
481  | 		/**
482  | 		 **  Select the first one on the list which is either a
483  | 		 **  modulefile or another directory. We start at the highest
484  | 		 **  lexicographical name in the directory since the filelist
485  | 		 **  is reverse sorted.
486  | 		 **  If it's a directory, we delve into it.
487  | 		 **/
488  | 		for( i=0; i<numlist && Result==NULL; i++) {
489  | 	char	 *filename;
490  | 		    /**
491  | 		     **  Build the full path name and check if it is a
492  | 		     **  directory. If it is, recursively try to find there what
493  | 		     **  we're seeking for
494  | 		     **/
495  | 			filename = uvec_vector(filelist)[i];
496  | 		    if ((char *)NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
497  | 			path, "/", filename, NULL))
498  | 			    goto unwind2;
499  | 
500  | 		    if( !stat( fullpath, &stats) && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
501  | 			Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, prefix, filename);
502  | 		    } else {
503  | 			/**
504  | 			 **  Otherwise check the file for a magic cookie ...
505  | 			 **/
506  | 			if( check_magic( fullpath, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
507  | 			    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) 
508  | 			    Result = filename;
509  | 		    } /** if( !stat) **/
510  | 		} /** for **/
511  | 	    } else {  /** default **/
512  | 		/**
513  | 		 **  If mod names a file, we have to check wheter it exists and
514  | 		 **  is a valid module file
515  | 		 **/
516  | 		if( check_magic( fullpath, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
517  | 		    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) 
518  | 		    Result = mod;
519  | 		else {
520  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, fullpath, NULL);
521  | 		    Result = NULL;
522  | 		}
523  | 	    } /** if( mod is a filename) **/
524  | 	    /**
525  | 	     **  Build the full filename (using prefix and Result) if
526  | 	     **  Result is defined
527  | 	     **/
528  | 	    if( Result) {
529  | 		int len = strlen( Result) + 1;
530  | 
531  | 		if( prefix)
532  | 		    len += strlen( prefix) + 1;
533  | 
534  | 		if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, len, NULL))) {
535  | 		   ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
536  | 		   goto unwind2;
537  | 		}
538  | 		if( prefix) {
539  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t,len, prefix,"/",Result,NULL))
540  | 			goto unwindt2;
541  | 		} else {
542  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t,len, Result,NULL))
543  | 			goto unwindt2;
544  | 		}
545  | 		Result = t;
546  | 		if (0) {	/* an error occurred */
547  | unwindt2:
548  | 		    null_free((void *) &t);
549  | 		    goto unwind2;
550  | 		}
551  | 	    } 
552  | 	} /** mod is a file **/
553  |     } /** mod exists **/
554  |     /**
555  |      **  Free up temporary values and return what we've found
556  |      **/
557  |     null_free((void*) &fullpath);
558  |     null_free((void*) &s);
559  |     FreeList( &filelist);
560  |     
561  |     return( Result);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
562  | 
563  | unwind2:
564  |     null_free((void *) &fullpath);
565  | unwind1:
566  |     null_free((void *) &s);
567  | unwind0:
568  |     return(NULL);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
569  | 
570  | } /** End of 'GetModuleName' **/
571  | 
572  | /*++++
573  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
574  |  ** 									     **
575  |  **   Function:		SourceRC					     **
576  |  ** 									     **
577  |  **   Description:	Source the passed global RC file		     **
578  |  ** 									     **
579  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
580  |  ** 									     **
581  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter	     **
582  |  **			char		*path		Path to be used      **
583  |  **			char		*name		Name of the RC file  **
584  |  **									     **
585  |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Success		     **
586  |  **					TCL_ERROR	Failure		     **
587  |  **									     **
588  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
589  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
590  |  **					control everything		     **
591  |  ** 									     **
592  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
593  |  ++++*/
594  | 
595  | int SourceRC( Tcl_Interp *interp, char *path, char *name)
596  | {
597  |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
598  |     int 	  save_flags, i;
599  |     char	 *buffer;
600  |     int		  Result = TCL_OK;
601  |     static char	**srclist = (char **) NULL;
602  |     static int	  listsize = 0, listndx = 0;
603  | 
604  |     /**
605  |      **  If there's a problem with the input parameters it means, that
606  |      **  we do not have to source anything
607  |      **  Only a valid TCL interpreter should be there
608  |      **/
609  |     if( !path || !name)
610  | 	return( TCL_OK);
611  | 
612  |     if( !interp)
613  | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
614  |     /**
615  |      **  Build the full name of the RC file
616  |      **  Avoid duplicate sourcing
617  |      **/
618  |     if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, path,"/",name, NULL)))
619  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
620  | 	    goto unwind0;
621  |     for( i=0; i<listndx; i++)
622  | 	if( !strcmp( srclist[ i], buffer))
623  | 	    goto unwind1;
624  |     /**
625  |      **  Check whether the RC file exists and has the magic cookie inside
626  |      **/
627  |     if( !stat( buffer, &stats)) {
628  | 	if( check_magic( buffer, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
629  | 	    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) {
630  | 	    /**
631  | 	     **  Set the flags to 'load only'. This prevents from accidently
632  | 	     **  printing something
633  | 	     **/
634  | 	    save_flags = g_flags;
635  | 	    g_flags = M_LOAD;
636  | 	    /**
637  | 	     **  Source now
638  | 	     **/
639  | 	    if( TCL_ERROR == Execute_TclFile( interp, buffer)) 
640  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_SOURCE, LOC, buffer, NULL)) 
641  | 		    Result = TCL_ERROR;
642  | 	    g_flags = save_flags;
643  | 	    /**
644  | 	     **  Save the currently sourced file in the list
645  | 	     **  Check whether the list is big enough to fit in a new entry
646  | 	     **/
647  | 	    if( !listsize) {
648  | 		listsize = SRCFRAG;
649  | 		if((char **) NULL
650  | 			== (srclist = (char **) module_malloc( listsize *
651  | 		    sizeof( char **)))) {
652  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
653  | 		    goto unwind1;
654  | 		}
655  | 	    } else if( listndx + 1 >= listsize) {
656  | 		listsize += SRCFRAG;
657  | 		if((char **) NULL == (srclist = (char **) module_realloc(
658  | 		    srclist, listsize * sizeof( char **)))) {
659  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
660  | 		    goto unwind1;
661  | 		}
662  | 	    }
663  | 	    /**
664  | 	     **  Put the current RC files name on the list
665  | 	     **/
666  | 	    srclist[ listndx++] = buffer;
667  | 
668  | 	} else {
669  | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, buffer, NULL);
670  | 	    null_free((void *) &buffer);
671  | 	}
672  |     } else {	/** if( !stat) - presumably not found **/
673  | 	null_free((void *) &buffer);
674  |     }
675  |     /**
676  |      **  Return our result
677  |      **/
678  |     return( Result);
679  | 
680  | unwind1:
681  |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
682  | unwind0:
683  |     return( TCL_ERROR);
684  | 
685  | } /** End of 'SourceRC' **/
686  | 
687  | /*++++
688  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
689  |  ** 									     **
690  |  **   Function:		SourceVers					     **
691  |  ** 									     **
692  |  **   Description:	Source the '.version' file			     **
693  |  ** 									     **
694  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
695  |  ** 									     **
696  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter	     **
697  |  **			char		*path		Path to be used      **
698  |  **			char		*name		Name of the module   **
699  |  **									     **
700  |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Success		     **
701  |  **					TCL_ERROR	Failure		     **
702  |  **									     **
703  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
704  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
705  |  **					control everything		     **
706  |  ** 									     **
707  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
708  |  ++++*/
709  | 
710  | int SourceVers( Tcl_Interp *interp, char *path, char *name)
711  | {
712  |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
713  |     int save_flags;
714  |     char *buffer;
715  |     int Result = TCL_OK;
716  |     char *version;
717  |     char *new_argv[3];
718  |     char *mod, *ver;
719  | 
720  |     /**
721  |      **  If there's a problem with the input parameters it means, that
722  |      **  we do not have to source anything
723  |      **  Only a valid TCL interpreter should be there
724  |      **/
725  |     if( !path || !name)
726  | 	return( TCL_OK);
727  |     if( !interp)
728  | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
729  |     /**
730  |      **  No default version defined so far?
731  |      **/
732  |     if( VersionLookup( name, &mod, &ver) &&
733  | 	strcmp( ver, _(em_default)))
734  | 	return( TCL_OK);
735  |     /**
736  |      **  Build the full name of the RC file and check whether it exists and
737  |      **  has the magic cookie inside
738  |      **/
739  |     if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, path,"/",version_file,
740  | 	NULL)))
741  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
742  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);
743  |     if( !stat( buffer, &stats)) {
744  | 	if(
745  | #if VERSION_MAGIC != 0
746  | 	    check_magic( buffer, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
747  | 	    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)
748  | #else
749  | 	1
750  | #endif
751  | 	) {
752  | 	    save_flags = g_flags;
753  | 	    g_flags = M_LOAD;
754  | 
755  | 	    if( TCL_ERROR != (Result = Execute_TclFile( interp, buffer)) && 
756  | 		(version = (char *) Tcl_GetVar(interp, "ModulesVersion", 0))) {
757  | 		int	objc = 3;
758  | 		Tcl_Obj **objv;
759  | 		/**
760  | 		 **  The version has been specified in the
761  | 		 **  '.version' file. Set up the result code
762  | 		 **/
763  | 		null_free((void *) &buffer);
764  | 		if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0,
765  | 		name,"/",version, NULL)))
766  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
767  | 			return( TCL_ERROR);
768  | 
769  | 		new_argv[0] = "module-version";
770  | 		new_argv[1] = buffer;
771  | 		new_argv[2] = _(em_default);
772  | 		Tcl_ArgvToObjv(&objc, &objv, 3, new_argv);
773  | 		/**
774  | 		 **  Define the default version
775  | 		 **/
776  | 		if( TCL_OK != cmdModuleVersion( (ClientData) 0,
777  | 		    (Tcl_Interp *) NULL, 3, objv)) {
778  | 			Result = TCL_ERROR;
779  | 		}
780  | 	    } /** if( Execute...) **/
781  | 
782  | 	    g_flags = save_flags;
783  | 
784  | 	} else
785  | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, buffer, NULL);
786  | 
787  |     } /** if( !stat) **/
788  |     /**
789  |      ** free buffer memory
790  |      **/
791  |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
792  |     /**
793  |      **  Result determines if this was successful
794  |      **/
795  | 
796  |     return( Result);
797  | 
798  | } /** End of 'SourceVers' **/
799  |
